articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Fish Farm under KPA Unit 580
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Fish Farm under KPA Unit 580
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, inspected the fish farm managed by Om Tok Song under the Korean People's Army Unit 580.
					
					 After being briefed on the farm before a board of diagram on its management, he toured fishponds to acquaint himself in detail with fish production.
					
					 Seeing gold carp and rainbow trout as big as forearm and other fishes bred in the farm, he learned about how much fish the farm has produced this year and what kind of unit they were supplied and what soldiers and civilians' reaction to them was.
					
					 Water is most important in guaranteeing the conditions for growth of fish, he said, inquiring about amount and temperature of fountain water flowing into the fishponds.
					
					 Asking about such matters as feed and additives for it, he said that natural fodder including pupa is desirable for fish breeding to ensure peculiar flavor of fish and hygienic safety.
					
					 He also acquainted himself in detail with cultivation of Rana omativentris launched at the fish farm lately.
					
					 Rana omativentris living at brooks in different hills and valleys of our country is beneficial animal used as health food, he noted, and gave a high appreciation of the farm which started the rearing of such frogs.
					
					 He advanced tasks for managing the fish farm.
					
					 Fountains and hot springs should be utilized to the full and all places good to breed fish found out to build more fish breeding grounds so that every place with water can be teeming with shoal of fishes, he said, adding:
					
					 Primary attention should be paid to raising coldwater fishes including rainbow trout whose economic effectiveness has been clearly proved over the past years.
					
					 It is important to intensify the scientific research and steadily enhance the role of breeders and technicians.
					
					 If officials make detailed arrangements, it is quite possible for the farm to produce much more fishes since it has solid material and technical foundations and rich experience.
					
					 He ardently called for making steady and big efforts to fish breeding which can be done easily anywhere and is of practicality and thus providing more fishes to servicepersons and people.
					
					 Accompanying him were Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, and Han Kwang Sang, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Employees of Tanchon Magnesia Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Employees of Tanchon Magnesia Factory

					Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave his handwriting to a letter dated October 17 from the employees of the Tanchon Magnesia Factory.
					
					 In the letter to the leader they stressed that the significant field guidance provided by him in October served as a historic occasion in instilling optimism and fresh faith in victory into all workers and officials of the factory and encouraging them to make a higher leap forward.
					
					 They said that thanks to his deep trust and love they could build a modern fuel production base of Korean-style and produce light burned magnesia by anthracite gasification.
					
					 We will display to the whole world that the determination of the Korean working class to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a great auspicious event of Songun Korea under your leadership is never empty words, they pledged.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Inhabitants of South Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Inhabitants of South Hamgyong Province

					Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave his handwriting to a letter dated October 24 from officials, labor innovators, scientists and technicians of South Hamgyong Province who went back home after their tour of Pyongyang.
					
					 In the letter to the leader they stressed that the great devotion and benevolent love shown by Kim Jong Il served as a fundamental source of the creation of fresh miracles and feats, the torch of South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 They expressed the resolve to become a seed of fanning up the flames of South Hamgyong Province in the ongoing final charge for opening the gate to prosperity.
					
					 We will keep the vinalon production going at a high rate, mass-produce various kinds of quality chemical goods from vinalon intermediate products and complete the second-phase Hungnam gasification process construction at the highest level at an early date to creditably perfect the Juche-orientation of fertilizer production, the letter said.

articles.title: Greetings to Nicaraguan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Nicaraguan President
						

					Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Daniel Ortega Saavedra upon his reelection as President of Nicaragua.
					
					Kim in the message heartily wished the President success in his responsible work for national unity, sustained development of the economy and well-being of the people, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily develop.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guatemala
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guatemala
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Otto Perez Molina upon his election as President of Guatemala.
					
					 Kim in the message wished the President success in his responsible work for development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in the common desire and interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Acquaints Himself with Various Fields in Hamhung
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Acquaints Himself with Various Fields in Hamhung
						

					 Hamhung, November 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the work of various fields in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province on Nov. 9.
					
					 He looked around the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex and scientific research institutes and public catering networks to learn in detail about the production, the development of new technologies and public service to the people. 
					
					 He discussed practical issues to thoroughly carry out the instructions given by leader Kim Jong Il to relevant units during his field guidance. 
					
					 At the meetings, the premier pressed for measures to smoothly solve the problems arising in pushing ahead with the construction of air-tight carbide electric furnace, 75-ton cyclic boiler and the second-phase of Hungnam gasification project in order to keep the production of vinalon, fiber of our own invention, and the Juche fertilizer going at a high rate and hasten the production of ordered equipment including a geothermal pump.

articles.title: Li Jinai Stresses Need to Boost China-DPRK Cooperation
articles.content:
Li Jinai Stresses Need to Boost China-DPRK Cooperation 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Li Jinai, director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Friday underscored the need for China and the DPRK to boost bilateral exchange and cooperation and thus contribute to development of ties between the two countries and armies. 
					
					 He said this at a friendly talk with the delegation of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces led by Col. Gen. Ri Thae Chol in Beijing.
					
					 Li at the talk noted that the traditional China-DPRK friendly relations have steadily developed under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: KPISF Delegation Comes Back Home
articles.content:
KPISF Delegation Comes Back Home
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces led by Col. Gen. Ri Thae Chol came back home on Saturday after visiting China.

articles.title: Front-runners in Building Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Front-runners in Building Thriving Nation    
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Many people of the DPRK have become front-runners in the effort to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Among them are Mun Kang Sun, a weaver of the Pyongyang Textile Mill, Jong Yon Ok, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Township Co-op Farm in Yonan County, South Hwanghae Province, Choe Ho Song, an engineer of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and U Won Yong, a collier of the Inpho Coal Mine under the Pukchang Area Coal Mining Complex.
					
					After joining the mill, Mun Kang Sun has woven some 555,000 meters of cloth by operating many weaving machines at full capacity.
					
					 Over the past decade, she has overfulfilled the yearly plan at an average of 200 percent.
					
					 Jong Yon Ok, who has worked as chairwoman of the management board for 23 years, set an example in double cropping, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Rice farming is preceded by potato farming in Yonbaek Plain. The successful double cropping method of her farm has been applied to co-op farms across the country.
					
					 Choe Ho Song has contributed to basing the country's metal industry on locally available raw materials and fuel over the past three decades. He has solved many scientific and technical problems arising in boosting the rolled steel production with less manpower and fuel.
					
					 U Won Yong, with a 20-odd-year-long career as miner, has guided his workteam to top its targets every year.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il highly appreciated them for their distinguished services and encouraged all other people to follow their example.

articles.title: S. Korean Army to Stage Anti-DPRK Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Army to Stage Anti-DPRK Exercises 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The 30th division of the puppet army is mulling staging anti-DPRK war exercises in Koyang, Phochon and Ryonchon areas of Kyonggi Province on Nov. 18 and 26, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					
					 The exercises will be held under the signboard of reviewing combat command ability. To be involved are huge armed forces including armored unit under the division. 
					
					 The unabated anti-DPRK war exercises are straining the situation in and around the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Struggle against FTA Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against FTA Launched in S. Korea 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- People of different walks of life in south Korea, including members of the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement, launched a struggle against the conclusion of the FTA with the U.S. in Seoul on Nov. 10.
					
					 A rally for checking the "National Assembly" ratification of the agreement took place. 
					
					 FTA is only for the interests of the U.S. which drove the global economy to crisis, speakers at the rally said, declaring that they would fight until the "Grand National Party" repeals the conclusion of the agreement. 
					
					 A resolution was read out at the rally. 
					
					 After the rally, its participants took a demo, marching toward the building of GNP. 
					
					 Chanting "No FTA!" the demonstrators stubbornly fought against the police firing water cannons at them. 
					
					 11 of them were walked away by the police and some wounded by its violent repression. 
					
					 That evening, there was a candlelight rally in Youido with attendance of workers, farmers, students and other citizens and members of opposition parties standing against the conclusion of the humiliating agreement.
					
					 The ralliers said that the conclusion of FTA means south Korea's economic annexation to the U.S. and, accordingly, south Korea's economic sovereignty would be deprived and its industry totally destroyed by the U.S.
					
					 They called for cooperation with the DPRK to tide over the economic crisis. 
					
					 The candlelight rally against the FTA conclusion will go on, they warned.

articles.title: Authorities' Scheme to Distort History Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Scheme to Distort History Protested in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on Nov. 9 denounced the puppet authorities for tampering with history.
					
					 The "government", while mending the standard of writing history textbooks, has decided to cancel all the facts about the movement for democracy conducted in the period of the dictatorial regime, the commentary noted, adding:
					
					 This is an ulterior scheme to revive fascist dictatorship and stamp out the movement for democracy.
					
					 It is a foolish attempt of the present "government" to infuse distorted history into the younger generation.
					
					 The commentary urged the authorities to stop at once such moves.

articles.title: World Community Will See Fresh Event in DPRK: Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
World Community Will See Fresh Event in DPRK: Nigerian Organization
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on November 5 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "After the Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea".
					
					 After the Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea the world has kept its eyes on the DPRK, the article noted, adding:
					
					 It is because events drawing the attention of the international community would surely take place in the DPRK after every party conference in the past.
					
					 After the first WPK Conference in March 1958 a socialist system was established and the 5-Year Plan was carried out ahead of schedule in the DPRK, thus registering striking achievements in overall economic construction.
					
					 After the second conference in October 1966, a vigorous drive to implement the line of simultaneously building up the economy and defenses was conducted and the industrial output drastically increased. As a result, the significant task for socialist industrialization in the DPRK was successfully carried out in a short span of time.
					
					 The historical facts make one foresee that a fresh event will take place in the DPRK after the Workers' Party of Korea Conference in September 2010, the third of its kind.
					
					 The world community will witness a new event in which the Korean people open the gate to prosperity under the leadership of the Party.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Laos
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Laos
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee was formed in Laos to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Tong Yeu Tho, chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association who is member of the C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Party and standing vice-chairman of the C.C., National Construction Front of Laos, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.

articles.title: Work of Kim Jong Il Posted on Internet
articles.content:
Work of Kim Jong Il Posted on Internet
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its Internet homepage General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Firmly Arm Ourselves with the Juche-oriented Theory of Socialist Economic Management" on November 6.
					
					 The work, published on July 1, 1991, clarifies in detail the basic principles, system and method of socialist economic management.

articles.title: China Gives Priority to Mining Industry in Economic Growth
articles.content:
China Gives Priority to Mining Industry in Economic Growth
						

					 Beijing, November 11 (KCNA) -- China's vice-premier sent a letter to the 2011 international mining conference opened recently in Tianjin, on behalf of the government. 
					
					 In the letter, Li Keqiang explained the government's policy of giving priority to developing the mining industry. 
					
					 The letter said China's effort for modernization needs backing from the steadily developing mining industry.  
					
					 It underscored the need to develop the mineral prospecting, based on advanced technologies, and utilize resources in a comprehensive way, promoting a long-term, stable and rapid economic growth.

articles.title: China Issues Regulations for Preventing False Reports
articles.content:
China Issues Regulations for Preventing False Reports
						

					 Beijing, November 11 (KCNA) -- The State Press and Publication Administration of China recently released "Some regulations on strictly checking false reports." 
					
					 The regulations call upon the mass media to establish proper systems for preventing false reports, correcting misinformation and charging those responsible for fake with their irresponsibility.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Improving Service for People with Special Backgrounds
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Improving Service for People with Special Backgrounds

					 Beijing, November 11 (KCNA) -- The secretary of the Central Commission of Politics and Law of China called for improving the service for people who need special attention and assistance.  
					
					 Speaking at a meeting held on Monday, Zhou Yongkang said the service for ex-convicts, narcotic addicts, lunatics apt to cause accidents and AIDS patients is part of the effort for improving the social management.  
					
					 He underscored the need to improve the service to suit their characteristics.

articles.title: 80th anniversary of Chinese Soviet Republic Marked in China
articles.content:
80th anniversary of Chinese Soviet Republic Marked in China
						

					 Beijing, November 11 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Ruijin, Jiangxi Province on Monday to mark the 80th anniversary of the central revolutionary base and the Chinese Soviet Republic.  
					
					 Participants in the meeting looked back on the feats and traits of the proletarian revolutionaries of the elder generation and the revolutionary forerunners. They also reviewed the brilliant history and experience of the Communist Party in the period of the Chinese Soviet Republic.    
					
					 The meeting called for carrying forward what the revolutionary forerunners desired in their lifetime and giving full play to the spirit displayed in the Soviet district.

articles.title: New Oil Field Found in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region of China
articles.content:
-New Oil Field Found in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region of China
						

					 Beijing, November 11 (KCNA) -- New oil field was discovered recently in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region of China.
					
					 The oil reserves are estimated at about more than 20.71 million tonnes.

articles.title: Russian FM Denounces IAEA Report
articles.content:
Russian FM Denounces IAEA Report 
						

					 Moscow, November 11 (KCNA) -- The Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs denounced on November 8 a report made by the director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) about Iran's nuclear program.
					
					 The ministry said the report served as a source of presumptions, rumors and groundless political stories even before their official distribution to the member states of the organization. The report disappointed Russia and aroused its suspicion as it has become the cause of fresh tensions over Iran's nuclear issue.
					
					 It is important to correctly analyze whether there disclosed new reliable intelligence on Iran's nuclear program for military purposes or whether it was deliberately escalated, it stressed.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Establishing SCO Satellite Communication System
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Establishing SCO Satellite Communication System

					 Moscow, November 11 (KCNA) -- Russia's prime minister called for establishing a satellite communication system within the framework of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO.)
					
					 Speaking at a recent press conference, Vladimir Putin suggested that SCO pay attention to the establishment of its mobile satellite communication system proposed by Russia and China.  
					
					 He said the SCO member nations could take flexible and intensive forms to implement their cooperation programs.

articles.title: Russian War Veterans Urged to Launch Patriotic Education
articles.content:
Russian War Veterans Urged to Launch Patriotic Education 
						

					 Moscow, November 11 (KCNA) -- The Russian president called on war veterans to launch patriotic education among young people.  
					
					 Speaking at a recently-held meeting with veterans, Dmitri Medvedev said any book and TV programs can not serve for 
					
					living witnesses, adding, "I can never forget stories told by veterans." 
					
					 He stressed it is important for veterans to frequently contact with young people to tell them about the war.

articles.title: Russia to Restore Monuments to Patriotic War
articles.content:
Russia to Restore Monuments to Patriotic War
						

					 Moscow, November 11 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev in a recent meeting with war veterans clarified his stand to steadily carry on the work to restore monuments to the great Patriotic War.
					
					 He said many monuments have already been restored across the country as part of the preparations for commemorating the 65th anniversary of the victory in the war.
					
					 Noting that this work will go on and on, he said the government ratified a 2011-2015 special federal plan on restoring the monuments and allotted lots of funds to it.

articles.title: Iran Will Not Give up Nuclear Program: President
articles.content:
Iran Will Not Give up Nuclear Program: President 
						

					 Tehran, November 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on Nov. 9 clarified the country's firm stand not to give up its nuclear development program.
					
					 Referring to IAEA report on Iran's activities for the development of nuclear weapons, Ahmadinejad said the report is little different from the U.S. assertion. It also brought shame to the agency, he added.
					
					 The Iranian people would never loosen their vigilance nor step back from the path of their option, he said.

articles.title: Iran's Defence Chief Warns against Enemies' Moves
articles.content:
Iran's Defence Chief Warns against Enemies' Moves

					 Tehran, November 11 (KCNA) -- The minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran on Tuesday warned against the enemies' adventurous moves. 
					
					 Iran is fully ready to beat back the enemies' foolish moves, he said, stating that if they commit a hostile act against Iran, it will make a decisive counterattack.
					
					 The Iranian army and people closely watch the every move of the enemies in Persian Gulf and the Sea of Oman.

articles.title: Iran Threatens to Change Form of Cooperation with IAEA
articles.content:
Iran Threatens to Change Form of Cooperation with IAEA 

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The Iranian permanent representative to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), at a press interview on Wednesday, said his country will reconsider the form of cooperating with the UN agency. 
					
					 He accused IAEA of having made such a historical mistake as releasing a false report on Iran's nuclear program. 
					
					 It depends on the Iranian government's decision what form the country will take in cooperation with IAEA, he added.

articles.title: Brazilian President Sees Job Creation as Way to Tackle Crisis
articles.content:
Brazilian President Sees Job Creation as Way to Tackle Crisis
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff in her weekly radio show on Monday said job creation is a way to tackle economic crisis.
					
					 The current crisis, which is affecting the United States and the European Union, cannot be tackled by reducing workers' rights, she added.
					
					 Saying that her country will cope with the crisis by creating more jobs, she stressed that the difference between Brazil and the rich countries which are undergoing a crisis is that her country has a solid economy, with solid, regulated and controlled banks.

articles.title: Angola Demands End to U.S. Blockade of Cuba
articles.content:
Angola Demands End to U.S. Blockade of Cuba
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Angola expects that U.S. President Barack Obama heed the demand from the international community and lift the blockade of Cuba, which has affected the lives of millions of people for almost 50 years, Angolan Ambassador to Havana Jose Cesar Augusto said on Wednesday.
					
					 Augusto described the U.S. economic, commercial and financial blockade as "a crime against humankind".
					
					 "All the actions by the Cuban people to consolidate their own sovereignty and welfare will always count on the Angolan government's infallible support," said Augusto.
					
					 Augusto described relations between Luanda and Havana as excellent, saying that they were forged in the hard times of our struggle to free ourselves from colonialism.

articles.title: Iranian Speaker: U.S. Aims Anti-Iran Conspiracy
articles.content:
Iranian Speaker: U.S. Aims Anti-Iran Conspiracy

					 Tehran, November 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani at a press conference on Tuesday accused the U.S. of its conspiracy against his country.
					
					 The U.S. imposes sanctions and pressure on Iran and it has resorted to conspiracy against the Muslim nations to create discord among them while taking issue with nuclear issue and human rights in a bid to cover up its internal problems and prevent Tel Aviv regime from disintegration, he said.
					
					 The U.S. aims psychological warfare against Iran, he said, adding the other countries view the U.S. scenarios with doubt because they lack logical basis and are unbelievable.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- A landslide in Manizales, Colombia left 48 dead and dozens of others missing as of Wednesday. It also destroyed houses, displacing 150.
					
					 A series of strong wind accompanied by hailstones and heavy rain swept across Australia's state of Victoria the same day, leaving some 13,000 homes without electricity and damaging lots of houses.
					
					 A 5.6-magnitude quake that struck Van in eastern Turkey on Wednesday night collapsed at least 18 buildings, including two hotels.

articles.title: U.S. Military Deaths in Iraq at 4,484
articles.content:
U.S. Military Deaths in Iraq at 4,484
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- U.S. forces in Iraq have been killed by resistant forces in the country.
					
					As of Tuesday, Nov. 8, 2011, at least 4,484 members of the U.S. military had died in the Iraq war since it began in March 2003, according to an Associated Press count.
					
					 Since then, 32,224 U.S. service members have been wounded in hostile action, according to the Defense Department's weekly tally.

articles.title: Demonstrations Unabated in U.S.
articles.content:
Demonstrations Unabated in U.S.
						

					 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The Occupy Wall Street demonstrators launched two-week march from New York to Washington on November 9 amid protest against capitalism unabated in the U.S.
					
					 They will reportedly arrive at Washington on November 23 through Pennsylvania, Delaware and Maryland.
					
					 Earlier, demonstrators in Houston City, Texas set up tents in a park, staging a sit-in on November 8.
					
					 Riot police arrested several protestors.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspecciona piscifactoria de unidad del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspecciona piscifactoria de unidad del EPC 

					Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, inspecciono la piscifactoria adscrita a la Unidad 580 del Ejercito Popular de Corea, donde trabaja Om Tok Song. 
					
					Tras escuchar las explicaciones ante el plano sobre la gestion de la empresa, recorrio los criaderos haciendo conocimiento detallado del estado de la produccion de pescados. 
					
					Al ver las carpas doradas, las truchas irisadas y otros peces regordetes, averiguo minuciosamente sobre la cantidad de produccion de este ano, el lugar de suministro y el sentimiento de los militares y civiles que los probaron. 
					
					Lo mas importante para garantizar las condiciones de crecimiento de peces es el agua, dijo y se cercioro en detalles de la cantidad de agua del manantial y de su temperatura. 
					
					Pregunto como solucionan el problema de cebo y que utilizan como ingredientes agregados y enseno que para mantener el sabor de pescados y asegurar la seguridad higienica deben criar los peces con cebos naturales como crisalida. 
					
					Luego, el Dirigente averiguo los detalles de la cria de Rana ornatirentris, recien iniciada en la empresa. 
					
					Esta especie de pez util habita en los riachuelos de los valles de diferentes localidades del pais y se utiliza como alimento saludable, dijo y aprecio que la empresa haya comenzado la cria de Rana ornatirentris.
					
					El Dirigente indico las tareas que se presentan en la administracion de la piscifactoria. 
					
					Hay que aprovechar eficientemente los manantiales y aguas termales, y al mismo tiempo, encontrar todos los lugares adecuados a la cria de peces y construir mucho mas criaderos para que en todos los lugares con fuentes de agua se abunden los peces. 
					
					Para cumplir el plan de produccion de pescados deben prestar atencion primordial a criar los peces de agua fria como truchas irisadas, cuya eficiencia economica se ha comprobado claramente en la practica. 
					
					Para aumentar la produccion hace falta intensificar la investigacion cientifica y elevar constantemente el papel de los criadores y los tecnicos. 
					
					El Dirigente apunto encarecidamente la necesidad de seguir aportando gran fuerza a la piscicultura de gran utilidad para suministrar mucho mas pescados a los militares y civiles. 
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, y Han Kwang Sang, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia autografo a los innovadores de Hamnam
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia autografo a los innovadores de Hamnam
						

					Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el autografo a los funcionarios, innovadores laborales, cientificos y tecnicos de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur tras ver la carta que le dirigieran el 24 de octubre ellos mismos despues de visitar a Pyongyang.
					
					Los remitentes senalan en su carta que la gran abnegacion y cordial benevolencia del Dirigente generaron nuevos milagros y proezas en Hamnam (provincia de Hamgyong del Sur).
					
					Enfatizan que en la ofensiva final de hoy por abrir las puertas a la prosperidad, seran chispas en expandir mas las llamas laborales de Hamnam por todas las localidades del pais.
					
					Expresan sus determinaciones de normalizar en un alto nivel la produccion de vinalon, fabricar mucho los articulos quimicos de buena calidad utilizando los semiproductos de vinalon y perfeccionar satisfactoriamente la jucheanizacion de la produccion de abonos al terminar cuanto antes en alto nivel la construccion del proceso de segunda serie en la  gasificacion de Hungnam.

articles.title: Premier coreano averigua labores de ciudad de Hamhung
articles.content:
Premier coreano averigua labores de ciudad de Hamhung
						

					Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim estudio el dia 9 en el terreno las labores de varios dominios de la ciudad de Hamhung de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					Recorriendo el Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero, el Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong y las unidades de investigacion cientifica y de servicios gastronomicos publicos, el premier analizo en detalles el estado de produccion, el desarrollo de nuevas tecnologias y el servicio publico.
					
					En dichas unidades, Choe discutio los problemas practicos para materializar las instrucciones del Dirigente Kim Jong Il dadas en el terreno.
					
					Fueron tomadas en las reuniones consultivas las medidas para solucionar con satisfaccion los problemas que se presentan en normalizar la produccion de vinalon y abono autoctonos, al promover la construccion del horno electrico del carburo de calcio de tipo hermetico, la caldera de fluidez circulatoria de 75 toneladas y el proceso de segunda serie en la gasificacion de Hungnam, y adelantar la produccion de las instalaciones pedidas, tales como la bomba geotermica.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Daniel Ortega Saavedra
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Daniel Ortega Saavedra
						

					Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 11 un mensaje de felicitacion a Daniel Ortega Saavedra, reelegido como presidente de la Republica de Nicaragua. 
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran constantemente tambien en el futuro, el remitente formula sinceros votos por exitos en el trabajo responsable del mandatario para la unidad nacional, el desarrollo sostenido de la economia y el bienestar del pueblo.
